snippet: Cross-laminated timber, a sort of supersize plywood, is already popular in Europe in ever-taller buildings that can be a cheaper and environmentally friendly alternative to traditional buildings.
abstract: Cross-laminated timber, a type of high-tech plywood, is among a growing list of engineered wood products that are strong and rigid enough to replace steel and concrete as structural elements of bigger buildings; products, which are cheap and environmentally friendly, are already popular in some European cities.
lead_paragraph: Cross-laminated timber, a sort of supersize plywood, is already popular in Europe in ever-taller buildings that can be a cheaper and environmentally friendly alternative to traditional buildings.

headline.seo: Lofty Ambitions for Cross-Laminated Timber Panels
